author: Vinzenz Schroeter
comment: Pretty unstable in my opinion. Feature request: One thing that is missing for me is that you can't see the alternate text for an image. For example xkcd puts a second joke in the alt= part. In chrome you can see it by long-pressing an image.

author: Aaron Chow
comment: Stopped working with Feedly.  Edit: DEVs fixed it in a few days. Working again now, and is my favorite Feedly client once again.

reply.author: LevelUp Studio
reply.content:
Hi,
Something changed on Feedly servers. We updated the app to fix this issue. 

Sorry for the inconvenience!

author: Kyle Jahnke
comment: The app no longer works on numerous networks that the app used to work on. Repeatedly tells me to check my network connection when I clearly have connection.

reply.author: LevelUp Studio
reply.content:
Hi,
Something changed on Feedly servers. We updated the app to fix this issue. 

Sorry for the inconvenience!

author: Ventsyslav Raikov
comment: If I leave the phone to go to sleep while reading an article it will close the app and article will be lost

author: Koay Chiang Teik
comment: Can't cache offline contents to SD card.  Selective feedly my synchronisation would be very nice.  Other than that it's a very nice feed reader.

author: Thomas Veith
comment: It's working again, thanks for fixing!!!

reply.author: LevelUp Studio
reply.content:
Hi,
Something changed on Feedly servers. We updated the app to fix this issue. 

Sorry for the inconvenience!

author: Arnold Rimmer
comment: Buggy as hell but a good attempt. Images arent filtered so you end up with thumbnails stretched fullscreen which looks awful, can barely make out the images. No pre-cache, inbuilt browser isnt very useful and leaves you having to load in a third party browser. Design is somewhat confusing and not user freindly. But the reason im uninstalling is whole feed categories are disapearing after a related article is loaded. Just not good enough to keep.
This is the news app I've been looking for

author: Clinton Mikel
comment: Needs voice reading option.  Needs option to change rendering for when default doesn't work right. When these 3 features get added, palabre will definitely beat greader (no other rss reader comes close) . As of now, they are probably tied - greader is getting dated and fatally buggy.

author: Sean Piercy
comment: Requiring users to pay for a black theme is bad business. It obviously saves a significant amount of power on AMOLED devices and I won't use apps that don't offer it, especially if there's a viable alternative that does, which in this case there is. I definitely won't use or recommend this app to anyone else. Considering charging for advanced features that aren't imho a necessity.

author: Nathanael Thorn
comment: The nicest looking RSS reader I have found to date. It has a few bugs in the refresh logic that don't seem like they're going to be addressed, but I have learned to work around them.

author: Brittany Cherry
comment: Can I give more than a 5 star review. Oh my goodness. I have been searching and tinkering with so many devises and programs trying to create what this app does. I have finally found my solution.  I have a wide variety of interests. The problem is, how do I explore topics without getting bogged down with the sheer volume of information being thrown at me? Solution? This app.  I added each one of my YouTube subscriptions and other sites as RSS feeds into feedly and organized them by genre. I then added them onto this app and added a widget to my homescreen. Perfect organization.  This also has a widget that lets you view your feed based off of your twitter lists! No other app I could find did this. On top of that, the widget has images! Just absolutely exactly what I was looking for.  So far, it is smooth and functioning well for me. I'm sure it does even more than I have discovered.  This app is awesome.

author: wolfram seidl
comment: Update 27.10.17: Beware, still no offline mode. False advertising. This app is useless. It just looks nice. Palabre DOES NOT save articles for offline reading. The one and only feature I expect from a rss reader...

author: Nico Brandes
comment: I like the app but it seems to be quite unstable. Only app that manages to completely crash my phone on a regular basis.  No updates for quite a while.. Edit: seems abandoned, still crashing on a regular basis

author: Barry McKinlay
comment: Dev REALLY needs to offer a way to turn off "Similar Content" section. For a "personal" RSS reader, by forcing content YOU think I should read is ANYTHING but personal. Add page "flicks" like Feedly to be awesome.

author: Sameer Cooshna
comment: I have been using Palabre since it's inception, and it has done a good job as my primary news reader. It is simple to use, fast to load and easy to add your favourite RSS feeds to!

author: Yang Lu
comment: It loses my spot all the time in a long list of articles.  I click into an article, maybe click a link in the article, then come back into the list view again, the list refreshes automatically for offline purposes and then it automatically takes me back to the top.  So if I have 2d worth of material it'll bring me back to most recent (which I skipped on purpose).

author: Earl DePass Jr.
comment: Full featured news reader with nice widgets. Developer has been releasing more frequent updates.  My only real complaint is that it consumes to much battery.

author: Deepak George
comment: App is freezing and crashing on launch then after sometime it will work on my nexus 6p with Oreo.   Functionality and UI is exceptional but app need to be more fluid and smooth.  Definitely the best RSS reader if actively updated by the developer unlike last year were app was not given any updates.

author: Sam Fox
comment: Needs two things for it to be five stars for me: 1. The ability to show the first sentence or two of the article on the widget, like a lot of the old scrollable news widgets did. 2. The ability to change the time format on the widget (so instead of '1 hour ago' it says '21 October at 13:00', as an example).

The app WAS awesome. The first week after I installed it it worked great and I considered it to be a worthy successor to Feedly, which I've been having problems with for a long time.  That lasted a week. Now I can start the app and read a few articles before I start hitting slowdown. First the article scrolling will either freeze or go really slow, and then when you back out into the feed it'll continue to do the same thing. On top of that, using it regularly crashes my phone. When it freezes, it freezes my entire phone, either hard rebooting it or forcing me to restart it.   With a little extra work and a few extra features this could be an amazing Feedly substitute. But from what I've read in the reviews, it seems that these problems have been going on for awhile and likely won't be fixed. Time to look for another substitute.

author: Alejandro Contreras
comment: Really liking this product but for some strange reason it isn't syncing everything from feedly. Its nice and quick, the paid feature to remove intrusive adds is great with the added value of quick menu's.

author: Joel Frese
comment: Still one of the better RSS readers but very limited due to it's lack of sources editing. It's tedious. You can't move or delete groups of sources at a time. It also refuses to use SD memory, so it crashes the phone easily. It won't read .opml files correctly and put sources into groups. I hope we get these problems fixed because this could be the best RSS reader. Needs work. Readability feature doesn't download the entire article so you must be online. Developer wants you to pay IN THE app. No way. Please just charge a flat app fee.

author: David Miller
comment: I used News+ for years but the app hasn't been updated since 1/15 so it's time to give it up.  I've tried many RSS readers and just couldn't find one that works well with Feedly and how I read the news.  This app is outstanding!  I gladly paid the $2.49 to get the premium version.

author: Andrew Johnston
comment: This is absolutely brilliant - exactly what I have been looking for since the death of Google Currents. Clean, full-featured offline RSS reader which isn't trying to be anything else. Also very cheap for the Pro version. Keep up the good work!

author: Jeff Davis
comment: Best RSS reader app I've used on any platform. Attractive and efficient UI (love the Black theme) and synching is quick as well. Great experience!

author: Mark Stahler
comment: Pallabre is the best RSS reader with Feedly support for the Android platform. Period. I have tried all the popular apps (and paid for them) and this is by far the best. FeedMe comes 2nd place.

author: Adam D
comment: Sick of the mid scroll article refresh that takes me to the top of the list after I've scrolled through 300 articles. Moving on to a new app.

author: Andrij K.
comment: tried all rss readers. this one is created to be on the top. using it for 2 years already. And thanks for rejoining to updating your reader

author: Thomas Malenich
comment: This is a great app and love the widget customization. One request - could you add an option in the widget for magazine appearance? It's a great option and look within the app and I've never seen it on a news widget. It would be groundbreaking!

author: Mick I am
comment: Advanced design and layout, easy to read and so satisfying to look at. If you use a news feed reader, this is the one. Especially the dark theme.
Palabre still doesn't cache images for offline. I paid a long time ago and this has yet to be fixed.

author: Al McPhee
comment: Request failed. Please verify your internet connection...for a couple of days, on both my devices. Server problems?

author: Claudia R.
comment: nice alternative to Feedly bit of a learning curve and the Twitter feed doesnt do anything. adds are unintrusive.

author: David Ho
comment: One of my favorite apps. At one point it was definitely taking a lot of system resources, but seems to be Ok now. It has one of the best offline modes and that's what I love about it.

author: Scott Sawyer
comment: I could not figure out how to turn off the ads.  Also couldn't figure out how to get my new custom category to show on the main screen.  Uninstalling.
Spent an age searching for a feedly substitute, now I'm searching for a palabre substitute. This app is good in parts but I can't go back and browse old articles.

author: Josh Wood
comment: TBH It's one of the better feed/rss apps for Android, although there's not many quality apps to choose from. If it weren't for the recent batch of bugs I would probably rate it higher.

author: Benjamin Ho
comment: I like the interface. But I wish there was quicksave to Pocket from the list. Also, there is some tolerable stuttering.

author: Daniel Metille
comment: So far my favorite RSS reader. Only would like to be able to customize the action wheel. Edit: Thanks a lot for the update!
